title: Bio-Android Nursery Adventure #50
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Incubation Chamber
rooms.description: A sterile white chamber filled with rows of glowing incubation pods. Bio-androids in various stages of development float in translucent gel. Soft blue lights pulse rhythmically, and the air hums with the sound of life support systems. Monitoring stations line the walls, and cables snake across the floor. The temperature is precisely controlled, creating an almost womb-like atmosphere.

items.name: monitoring station
items.description: A computer terminal displaying vital signs and growth metrics for the bio-androids
items.text: SYSTEM STATUS: Facility operational since 2087. Chief Scientist: Dr. Helena Voss. Lead Engineer: Marcus Chen. All bio-android specimens are numbered sequentially. Current active pods: Alpha Seven, Beta Three, Gamma Nine.

items.name: incubation pod alpha seven
items.description: A large cylindrical pod containing a nearly complete bio-android suspended in nutrient gel
items.text: Pod Alpha Seven - Status: 98% complete. Neural pathways: Fully integrated. Physical development: Optimal. Estimated completion: 24 hours.

items.name: incubation pod beta three
items.description: A pod with a bio-android in mid-stage development, its features still forming
items.text: Pod Beta Three - Status: 67% complete. Skeletal structure: Solidified. Organ development: In progress. Estimated completion: 72 hours.

items.name: medical supply cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with three compartments containing medical equipment and supplies

items.name: facility operations manual
items.description: A thick binder with operational procedures and protocols
items.text: Bio-Android Nursery Operations Manual - Established 2087. All personnel must follow safety protocols. Access to Control Center requires proper authorization. Emergency evacuation procedures are located in the Control Center archives.

items.name: security access keycard
items.description: A magnetic keycard with a blue stripe and security clearance markings

items.name: maintenance workbench
items.description: A metal workbench covered with tools and diagnostic equipment

items.name: technician log
items.description: A digital tablet with maintenance logs and personal notes
items.text: Maintenance Log - Marcus Chen: The combination to the middle compartment is the year we opened this facility. Dr. Voss keeps reminding me that proper documentation is essential. The bio-androids are developing perfectly in their growth pods.

items.name: nutrient storage tank
items.description: A large tank containing the specialized gel used in the incubation pods

items.name: adjustable wrench
items.description: A standard maintenance tool that could be useful

items.name: control center door
items.description: A reinforced door with a card reader and biometric scanner leading to the facility control center

rooms.name: Control Center
rooms.description: The nerve center of the bio-android facility. Multiple screens display real-time data from all incubation chambers. A large holographic display shows a rotating 3D model of a bio-android. Filing cabinets and research stations line the walls. The room has a clinical, high-tech atmosphere with soft white lighting and the constant hum of computers.

items.name: main control console
items.description: The primary control station with multiple monitors and input terminals
items.text: FACILITY CONTROL SYSTEM: All bio-android development monitored from this location. Chief Scientist Dr. Helena Voss oversees all research. Growth pods are the primary development chambers. Emergency exit protocols require proper authorization.

items.name: holographic display
items.description: A 3D projection showing detailed bio-android anatomy and systems
items.text: Bio-Android Development Model: Neural network integration complete at 98%. All specimens develop in specialized growth pods. Dr. Voss pioneered this revolutionary technology.

items.name: research desk
items.description: Dr. Voss's personal workstation covered with papers and data tablets

items.name: research journal
items.description: Dr. Voss's personal research notes and observations
items.text: Research Journal - Dr. Helena Voss: The bio-androids are developing beyond our expectations. Each specimen grows in its designated pod, monitored constantly. I am proud to be the chief scientist of this groundbreaking project. Emergency protocols are essential - only authorized personnel should access the exit bay.

items.name: filing cabinet
items.description: A secure cabinet containing classified research documents

items.name: personnel roster
items.description: A document listing all facility staff and their roles
items.text: FACILITY PERSONNEL: Dr. Helena Voss - Chief Scientist, Project Director. Marcus Chen - Lead Engineer, Systems Maintenance. Dr. Sarah Kim - Bio-Systems Specialist. All personnel have emergency evacuation training.

items.name: emergency protocol document
items.description: Official procedures for facility evacuation
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION PROTOCOL: In case of system failure or containment breach, proceed to Emergency Exit Bay. Authorization required. Security verification questions: Who is the chief scientist? Where do bio-androids develop? What is your clearance level?

items.name: equipment locker
items.description: A metal locker containing emergency supplies and protective gear

items.name: hazmat protective suit
items.description: A full-body suit required for safe evacuation through contaminated areas

items.name: wall mounted screen
items.description: A large display showing facility schematics and status reports
items.text: FACILITY SCHEMATIC: Incubation Chamber - Primary development area. Control Center - Monitoring and research hub. Emergency Exit Bay - Evacuation route. All bio-android specimens are classified as research personnel for security purposes.

items.name: emergency exit bay door
items.description: A heavy security door leading to the emergency exit bay. A terminal displays three security verification questions.

password_questions.question: Who is the chief scientist?
password_questions.hint: Check the monitoring station, research journal, and personnel roster

password_questions.question: Where do bio-androids develop?
password_questions.hint: Multiple documents mention where the bio-androids are grown

password_questions.question: What is your clearance level?
password_questions.hint: The wall screen mentions how bio-android specimens are classified

rooms.name: Emergency Exit Bay
rooms.description: You have reached the emergency exit! A clean, well-lit chamber with decontamination showers and an airlock leading outside. Emergency lights glow green, indicating safe passage. Through the reinforced window, you can see the outside world. A sleek evacuation pod sits ready in its launch cradle. You are safe now.

items.name: decontamination shower
items.description: An automated shower system for removing any biological contaminants

items.name: emergency evacuation pod
items.description: A small spacecraft designed for rapid evacuation to the nearest safe zone

items.name: reinforced window
items.description: A thick window showing the landscape outside the facility

items.name: emergency supply cache
items.description: A locker containing food, water, and medical supplies for evacuees

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You have escaped the Bio-Android Nursery and reached the emergency exit bay. The evacuation pod powers up, ready to transport you to safety. Behind you, the facility continues its work, but you have solved all the puzzles and found your way to freedom. The airlock opens, and fresh air rushes in. You win!
